abstract: Arthur John Patterson of California is extradited to South Korea to face trial on charges he murdered South Korean college student Jo Jung-pil in 1997; Patterson, the son of an American military contractor working in Seoul, was previously indicted and imprisoned on lesser charges, but was released in an annual government amnesty in 1998.
lead_paragraph: Arthur John Patterson, 35, denied killing a 22-year-old South Korean college student, a crime that a friend of his had been convicted and then acquitted of.

headline.main: American Is Extradited to South Korea for Trial in 1997 Murder
headline.print_headline: American Is Extradited to South Korea for Trial in 1997 Murder

snippet: Arthur John Patterson, 35, denied killing a 22-year-old South Korean college student, a crime that a friend of his had been convicted and then acquitted of.
